description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6jjru","text":"The study of neurogenesis is critical to understanding of the evolution of nervous systems. Within invertebrates, this process has been extensively studied in Drosophila melanogaster, which is the predominant model thanks to the availability of advanced genetic tools. However, insect nervous systems are extremely diverse, and by studying a range of taxa we can gain additional information about how nervous systems and their development evolve. However, studying this variation requires adapting labelling techniques to visualise cell division in less commonly studied organisms, as methods developed for common laboratory insects often do not work. Here, we present a modified protocol for EdU staining to examine neurogenesis in large-brained insects, using Heliconiini butterflies as our primary case, but also demonstrating applicability to cockroaches, another large-brained insect. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":159,"length":23},{"style":"italic","offset":183,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qm83","text":"\n\n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"152og","text":"This protocol has been modified from the instructions of the Click-iT™ EdU Cell Proliferation Kit for Imaging, Alexa Fluor™ 488 dye - Thermofisher. Note that some steps (e.g. prepare the stock solutions) have not been changed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2u5n","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

J Neurosci Methods. 2008;172(2):220–30. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9872b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"th7n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v18u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8tqmk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5jl9t","text":"The time of incubation will affect the number of cell cycles which are exposed to EdU, and therefore longer incubations will likely lead to more labelled cells in mitotically active tissue.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ej2l","text":"B)    In vivo incubation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7s5bv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cs0ma","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dstb","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d3g5i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"756F68601F3411EE92D415E19AE2E2E5","height":162.3345454545455,"id":388164,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IN VIVO.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m5cgb5izp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m5ceb5izp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m5cfb5izp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m5cdb5izp.webp","width":547.7546012269938}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e1hsu","text":"For active life stages, chill individuals in a refrigerator for a couple of minutes to anesthetize them. When ready, open a small window in the cuticle. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f9vg","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2eq44","text":"Incubate the brain in a solution of EdU diluted in Grace’s medium for 1-2h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77efk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1eq1o","text":"After the incubation, finish the dissection in HEPES-buffered saline, HBS ([150 mM] NaCl;\n[5 mM] KCl; [5 mM] CaCl2; [25 mM] sucrose; [10 mM HEPES]; pH 7.4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14gkq","text":"Transfer the brains to a 12 well plate, with up to 5 brains per well. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58v8o","text":"Fix the brain in a solution of paraformaldehyde, PFA (4% PFA in [0.1 M] phosphate-buffered saline (PBS; 7.4 pH) for 6-14h (Depending on the stage 14h for adults, 6-10h for larval stages). \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6nsn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3endr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2iffs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e7q4m","text":"Alternatively, zinc-formaldehyde, ZnFA (0.25% [18.4 mM] ZnCl2; 0.788% [135 mM] NaCl; 1.2% [35 mM] sucrose; 1% formaldehyde) can be used to fix the brains 14-16h (14h for larval brains, 16h for adult brains).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f87ld","text":"Remove the fixative and wash each well three times for 10 min with   of 0.1% Triton® X-100 in [0.1 M] PBS, 0.1%PBS-T.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9573i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72ep2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"72m0n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72b66","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"EE376F601C1711EE800A4D68D1E196D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"57boh","text":"If tissue sectioning is required, we suggest performing it at this stage.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eotlq","text":"Remove the PBS solution (from step 12).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5c3le","text":"Add   of 1% Triton® X-100 in [0.1 M] PBS, 1%PBS-T to each well. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b1lhc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"F45412401C1711EE800A4D68D1E196D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3485v","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 2h for whole brains, or 30 minutes for\nsectioned tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ju9o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90vsq","text":"Dilute 1X Click-iT® EdU buffer additive in deionized water at a ratio of 1:10. This should be prepared fresh and used on the same day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":103,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2cpjc","text":"Remove the permeabilization buffer (from step 3.15).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fl1cs","text":"Wash each well three times with 0.1% Triton® X-100 in [0.1 M] PBS, 0.1%PBS-T.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"esd2k","text":"Remove the wash solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3irss","text":"Prepare the Click-IT® reaction mix. Add the ingredients in the order defined by the manufacturer, replicated below. {"blocks":[{"key":"6qc9t","text":"Add   of the Click-iT® reaction cocktail to each well containing up to 3 brains, and  to each well containing 4-5 brains. Make sure the brains are completely covered in the reaction mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e0td6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"456D06F01C1811EE800A4D68D1E196D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"48867BF01C1811EE800A4D68D1E196D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgvr7","text":"Incubate the plate for 30 minutes at room temperature, protect from light using aluminium foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t26i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2977m","text":"Remove the reaction mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6loq","text":"Wash each well three times with   of 0.1% PBS-T (10 minutes each).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c5ij4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"5A4CCEC01C1811EE800A4D68D1E196D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"638s7","text":"Wash each well three times with   of 0.1% PBS-T.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3o9t6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"FAA6A7501C1911EEA01DB7D08A591E4D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6smsq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmcmn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eo2up","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32cjv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6oo9","text":"Incubate the brains under agitation in progressively more concentrated glycerol solutions: 1%, 2%, 4% (2 h each), 8%, 15%, 30%, 50%, 60%, 70%, and 80% (1 hour each) glycerol diluted in 0.1M Tris buffer, with DMSO to 1% final concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rti4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9dne0","text":"Clarification methods can vary. In the current study we followed Ott (2008).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b3ut9","text":"Wash the brains with 100% ethanol for 30 minutes under agitation, repeat three times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt7fn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afsnp","text":"Transfer each brain in a small amount of ethanol ( ) to an Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"47pfh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200-400","error":false,"guid":"1E89F8701C1A11EEA01DB7D08A591E4D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lq4o","text":"Underlay the ethanol with methyl salicylate, wait for brain to sink with no agitation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2rft0","text":"Aspirate the fluid from the top down, replace with fresh methyl salicylate and allow the brain to sink again for ~30 minutes with no agitation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":129,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eru27","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3it4m","text":"Aspirate the fluid and mount in fresh methyl salicylate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NUCLEAR STAINING with Hoechst 33342 or DAPI Staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fic8r","text":"Wash each well with 1 mL of miliQ H2O with 0.2% Triton for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"714rg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NUCLEAR STAINING with Hoechst 33342 or DAPI Staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f1f5g","text":"Remove the DAPI solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NUCLEAR STAINING with Hoechst 33342 or DAPI Staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4jcso","text":"Add 1 mL of diluted DAPI solution per well. Incubate for 2-3 hours for whole brains, or 30 minutes for sectioned tissue, at room temperature, protected from light. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":141,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98g93","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"embg6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45epl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NUCLEAR STAINING with Hoechst 33342 or DAPI Staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fj86l","text":"Dilute the DAPI solution in miliQ H2O at a ratio of 1:1000.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NUCLEAR STAINING with Hoechst 33342 or DAPI Staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"baatg","text":"Wash once in milliQ/deionized H2O with 0.2% Triton, 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mv4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NUCLEAR STAINING with Hoechst 33342 or DAPI Staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bnood","text":"Remove the wash solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NUCLEAR STAINING with Hoechst 33342 or DAPI Staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6g1qm","text":"Wash each well twice with 1 mL of [0.1 M] PBS (30 minutes each).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m653","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
